text: A carbonate is a chemical compound that has the carbonate ion, . This ion is made of carbon and oxygen. The name may also mean an ester of carbonic acid, an organic compound containing the carbonate group C(=O)(Oâ€“)2 of carbon and oxygen. They have a valency of 1. When added to an acid, a carbonate will produce carbon dioxide, water and a chemical salt. Sedimentary rocks containing calcite and other carbonates are plentiful in the earth. ==Related pages== *Bicarbonate *Calcium carbonate *Polycarbonate *Sodium carbonate Category:Oxyanions
title: Carbonate
